article_title: Obama touts economy, manufacturing in Cleveland
article_text:

article_metadata.description: CLEVELAND — Things have been bad for President Barack Obama. Bad website. Broken promises. Tanking polling numbers. So with all the controversy swirling around him over the implementation of the Affordable Care Act, the twice-elected Democrat slipped back into campaign mode, telling an audience of a few hundred at a Cleveland steel mill yesterday that the American auto industry he helped save led to resurgence in steel and manufacturing.
